DOC.brief_summary: Anxiety common mental health problem Canadian youth . Anxiety diagnose disorder serious enough require treatment affect 10 % youth age 16 . Anxiety disorder serious negative effect young person 's personal relationship , school performance , family life . These disorder may discover youth , parent health care provider . Even anxiety disorder discover , youth may get right therapy . Anxious youth become sick anxiety treat properly . The investigative team carry research test Breathe , new Internet-based treatment youth anxiety problem . Youth use treatment home . Breathe include information material personalize homework assignment help anxious youth learn way manage anxiety . This study pilot randomize control trial ( RCT ) two group , Internet-delivered cognitive behavioural therapy ( CBT ) experimental group ( Breathe ) resource webpage ( control group ; consider treatment usual youth wait service ) . The investigator evaluate several methodological process outcomes follow objective : 1 . To evaluate change youth ' anxiety ( primary outcome ) pre- post- intervention . 2 . To estimate recruitment retention rate full-scale RCT . 3 . To estimate sample size full-scale RCT . 4 . To define minimal clinically important difference ( MCID ) primary outcome measure . 5 . To measure intervention acceptability . 6 . To determine use co-interventions trial . 7 . To conduct preliminary economic analysis .
DOC.brief_title: Evaluating Internet-based Program Anxious Youth : Pilot RCT
